Rappuset.prompt: View 2024 findings. How many safety observations have taken place on the stairs? Also classify the most common safety observations that occur on stairs.
Rappuset.translation:
Analysis of safety observations on stairs (2024)
Based on this simulated data, a total of 14 safety observations were made in 2024 that were directly related to stairs or stairs.
The most common safety observations on stairs can be classified as follows:
1. Tripping hazard (2 observations) This is the single most common cause. It is caused by obstacles or items left on the stairs that can cause tripping.
Examples: "Items left on the stairs", "Garbage left on the stairs".
2. Structural deficiencies (5 observations) This category includes defects related to the structure of stairs, such as broken steps, wobbly railings or inadequate lighting.
Examples: "Wobbly handrail on stairs", "Inadequate lighting on stairs", "Stair anti-slip detachment", "Stair step broken".
3. Slip hazard (4 observations) This category includes observations where the slipperiness of the stairs has increased, for example, due to splashes, weather or worn surfaces.
Examples: "Slippery stairs", "Liquid splash on stairs", "Wet rag on stairs".
4. Incorrect action or behaviour (3 observations) This category includes observations in which a person's own actions cause a dangerous situation, such as running or carrying objects that block the field of vision.
Examples: "An employee ran up the stairs", "Carried a large box up the stairs"

Data.Heading: Water pond in the hallway
Data.Observation: There was a small puddle of water on the floor of the packaging department, which posed a risk of slipping.

Data.Heading: Swinging railing on the stairs
Data.Observation: On the metal stairs between the production facilities, the railing swayed dangerously. The fastening failed.

Data.Heading: Inadequate protective clothing
Data.Observation: The employee handled the powdered substance without a respirator in a clean room.

Data.Heading: Stuff left on the stairs
Data.Observation: Empty boxes had been left on the upper level of the stairs leading to the warehouse, there was a risk of tripping.

Data.Heading: Chemical splash on the floor
Data.Observation: In the laboratory, there was a small amount of unknown chemicals on the floor without a warning label.

Data.Heading: Emergency stop button covered
Data.Observation: In front of the emergency stop button on the mixer unit, there was a movable trolley that prevented quick operation.

Data.Heading: Slippery step
Data.Observation: One of the steps leading to the service platform was dangerously slippery.

Data.Heading: Heavy lifting without aids
Data.Observation: The warehouse worker lifted the heavy bag of raw materials alone without a lifting aid.

Data.Heading: Fire corridor blocked
Data.Observation: In front of the emergency exit, there was a pallet full of cardboard waste, which narrowed the passageway.

Data.Heading: Broken socket
Data.Observation: The casing of the socket in the dressing room was cracked, risk of electric shock.

Data.Heading: Inadequate lighting on the stairs
Data.Observation: The lighting in the stairwell leading to the basement was inadequate, one lamp was burnt out.

Data.Heading: Sharp edge at the workstation
Data.Observation: The metal worktop of the packaging line had a sharp edge that you could hurt yourself on.

Data.Heading: Tools on the floor
Data.Observation: After the maintenance work, a wrench and screwdrivers had been left on the floor.

Data.Heading: Liquid splash on the stairs
Data.Observation: Coffee had spilled on the stairs leading to the break room, causing a slipping hazard.

Data.Heading: Dust accumulated in the electrical cabinet
Data.Observation: A lot of dust had accumulated inside the old electrical cabinet of the production facility, a risk of fire.

Data.Heading: Incorrect waste sorting
Data.Observation: Reactive chemical waste had been placed in a normal laboratory waste container.

Data.Heading: An employee ran up the stairs
Data.Observation: The employee was observed running down the stairs on the office floor.

Data.Heading: Gas cylinders without support
Data.Observation: The gas cylinders in the laboratory stood freely against the wall without a chain or rack.

Data.Heading: Shelf overloaded
Data.Observation: The storage shelf had more stuff stacked than its weight limit allowed.

Data.Heading: Worn floor covering
Data.Observation: The floor covering in the cleanroom was worn out, making cleaning difficult and causing a tripping hazard.

Data.Heading: The anti-slip stair has come loose
Data.Observation: The anti-slip tape had come off the edge of the staircase leading to the front door and was torn.

Data.Heading: Damaged extension cord
Data.Observation: The insulation of the office extension cord had cracked, exposing internal wires.

Data.Heading: The liquid in the eyewash bottle has expired
Data.Observation: The eyewash bottle at the emergency shower station had expired.

Data.Heading: A forklift was speeding
Data.Observation: In the warehouse area, the forklift driver drove clearly over the permitted speed limit.

Data.Heading: Carrying a big box up the stairs
Data.Observation: The employee was carrying a large box that completely blocked the view when going up the stairs.

Data.Heading: Incomplete safety data sheets
Data.Observation: The safety data sheet for the new chemical could not be found at the workstation.

Data.Heading: Air conditioning duct leaks condensate
Data.Observation: An air conditioning duct in the ceiling of the corridor dripped condensate onto the floor.

Data.Heading: Muffler disconnected from the machine
Data.Observation: The muffler had come loose from the compressed air device, causing a lot of noise.

Data.Heading: Pharmaceutical dust on surfaces
Data.Observation: Pharmaceutical dust had remained on the surfaces of the weighing room after cleaning.

Data.Heading: Dim lighting in the warehouse
Data.Observation: At the back of the warehouse, the lighting was so dim that it was difficult to read the labels of the products.

Data.Heading: Garbage left on the stairs
Data.Observation: There was rubbish and empty coffee cups on the stairs of the break room.

Data.Heading: A heavy object on the edge of the shelf
Data.Observation: On a high storage shelf, there was a heavy box dangerously close to the edge.

Data.Heading: The door slams shut
Data.Observation: The door of the production facility slammed slammed shut, risk of crushing.

Data.Heading: Floor hatch poorly marked
Data.Observation: The floor hatch was open due to maintenance work, but there were no proper warning markings around it.

Data.Heading: Cable in the walkway
Data.Observation: A charging cable had been pulled across the office corridor, a tripping hazard.

Data.Heading: Protective gloves broken
Data.Observation: The employee wore broken protective gloves when handling the corrosive substance.

Data.Heading: Swinging stair railing
Data.Observation: The railing of the stairs at the main entrance swayed and gave way when leaning.

Data.Heading: The crane safety limit does not work
Data.Observation: The upper limit sensor of the production overhead crane did not work, causing a collision hazard.

Data.Heading: Broken glass on the floor
Data.Observation: In the laboratory, a beaker glass had fallen and shards had spread over a wide area.

Data.Heading: Hand washing station soap out of stock
Data.Observation: When entering the cleanroom, the soap dispenser at the hand washing station was empty.

Data.Heading: Slippery outdoor staircase in the rain
Data.Observation: The factory's exterior stairs were very slippery in the rain, no roughening.

Data.Heading: Emergency exit locked
Data.Observation: One of the emergency exits was locked with a key from the inside.

Data.Heading: Falling objects from the shelf
Data.Observation: The vibration caused small items to fall off the shelf near the production line.

Data.Heading: Wet rag on the stairs
Data.Observation: The cleaner had left a wet rag to dry on top of the stair railing, from where it had fallen onto the step.

Data.Heading: Inadequate ergonomics in the packing room
Data.Observation: The work surface on the packaging line was too low, causing the workers to stooped over their working position.

Data.Heading: Missing warning sign
Data.Observation: There was no sign warning about the wet floor after cleaning.

Data.Heading: Staircase step broken
Data.Observation: One of the steps on the concrete stairs was chipped, with a sharp edge and a pit.

Data.Heading: Noisy device
Data.Observation: One of the machines on the production line made an exceptionally loud, hissing noise.

Data.Heading: Icicles on the edge of the roof
Data.Observation: Large icicles hung above the main entrance, danger of falling.

Data.Heading: An employee was talking on a mobile phone on the stairs
Data.Observation: The employee walked down the stairs while looking at the phone screen, distracted.

Korjauspyyntö.prompt: Compare the safety observations made in 2024. How many ordinary repair requests have been incorrectly reported as safety observations.
Korjauspyyntö.translation:
Analysis: Safety Observations vs. Correction requests
Based on this simulated data, 18 observations can be classified as ordinary repair or maintenance requests that have been incorrectly reported as safety observations.
How was the difference defined?
Safety observation: A situation or deficiency that poses an immediate or potential risk to the health or safety of an employee. The risk may be related to an accident (slipping, falling, crushing), an occupational disease (exposure, ergonomics) or damage to property (fire, machine breakdown).
Example of material: "Missing machine guard" – poses a clear risk of entrapment and injury.
Example of material: "Cable in a passageway" – poses a clear risk of tripping and injury.
Correction request (mistakenly as a safety observation): A deficiency that is of the nature of a defect, inconvenience or defect, but does not cause an active safety risk. These are often matters related to maintenance, cleanliness or property management.
An example of the material: "Leaking faucet" – needs to fix the fault and wastes water, but does not pose a safety risk in this case.
Example of the material: "Worn chair upholstery" – is a purely aesthetic nuisance without a safety significance.
Example of material: "Wall clock stopped" – is a functional nuisance, but does not endanger anyone.
Summary of the comparison
In the 2024 data, the majority (about 70%) of the observations were genuine safety risks that required immediate attention. However, a significant proportion (about 30%) of the reports concerned minor defects and deficiencies.
This is a common phenomenon in organisations with a low threshold for reporting. Although it can put a strain on the safety system, it is often also a sign of a good safety culture, where staff are vigilant and report even the smallest deviations. The most important thing is the process by which these findings are correctly classified and controlled: urgent safety risks are prioritized and corrected immediately, while others are directed to the normal maintenance work queue.

Data.Heading: Leaking faucet
Data.Observation: The tap in the washbasin in the break room is dripping slowly. Does not cause water damage or slipping hazard, but consumes water.

Data.Heading: Cable in the walkway
Data.Observation: A temporary network cable installed by IT support ran across the office corridor, causing a tripping hazard.

Data.Heading: Shelf overloaded
Data.Observation: Too many boxes were visually stacked on the shelf in the dispatch room, which poses a risk of the shelf collapsing.

Data.Heading: Replacing a burnt-out bulb
Data.Observation: One of the many lamps in the storage corridor had burned out. The lighting in the area was still adequate, but weakened.

Data.Heading: Chemical splash on the floor
Data.Observation: There was a small amount of unknown liquid on the floor of the laboratory without warning markings.

Data.Heading: Emergency exit partially blocked
Data.Observation: A pallet full of raw materials had been left in front of the emergency exit, narrowing the passage significantly.

Data.Heading: Worn chair upholstery
Data.Observation: The upholstery of the seat of the office office chair is frayed. Only an aesthetic nuisance.

Data.Heading: Inadequate use of protective clothing
Data.Observation: An employee was moving an asthma-causing substance in a cleanroom without an appropriate respirator.

Data.Heading: Scratch on the wall
Data.Observation: The forklift has hit the wall and caused a deep scratch on the wall surface of the corridor. Only cosmetic damage.

Data.Heading: Open switchboard
Data.Observation: The door of the electrical center in the service room had been left open, leaving the live parts touchable.

Data.Heading: The locker door does not lock
Data.Observation: The door of one of the wardrobes in the dressing room does not lock properly. Does not pose a safety risk.

Data.Heading: Heavy lifting without aids
Data.Observation: An employee lifted a 25 kg sack from the floor alone without a lifting aid, a clear ergonomic risk.

Data.Heading: Trash bin full
Data.Observation: The paper collection container in the break room is full. It does not cause danger, but it is untidy.

Data.Heading: Sharp edge on the machine guard
Data.Observation: The protective cover of the tableting machine had a sharp edge, which causes a risk of cuts during maintenance work.

Data.Heading: Eyewash bottle inspection outdated
Data.Observation: The inspection date of the laboratory's emergency shower eyewash bottle had expired.

Data.Heading: Dust on top of the shelf
Data.Observation: Dust has accumulated on top of the high storage shelf. Does not pose a risk of product contamination or any other risk.

Data.Heading: Gas cylinders stored incorrectly
Data.Observation: The compressed air bottles stood on the wall of the warehouse without chain fastening, risk of tipping over.

Data.Heading: Damaged forklift fork
Data.Observation: The tip of the fork of one of the warehouse trucks was bent, which can cause unstable pallets and a risk of falling.

Data.Heading: Warning sign faded
Data.Observation: The warning sign indicating a wet floor was so faded that the text could no longer be clearly distinguished.

Data.Heading: The window won't open
Data.Observation: The mechanism of the ventilation window in the conference room is stuck. Not a safety risk, but hinders ventilation.

Data.Heading: Missing machine guard
Data.Observation: The mixer shaft lacked a guard, which creates a risk of getting caught when the machine is running.

Data.Heading: Incorrectly sorted waste
Data.Observation: Sharp laboratory material (needles) had been placed in the ordinary mixed waste.

Data.Heading: Hand paper at the end
Data.Observation: The hand paper dispenser in the toilet facilities was empty.

Data.Heading: Slippery floor at the entrance
Data.Observation: Due to the rainy weather, the floor of the main entrance was dangerously slippery, and there were not enough drying mats.

Data.Heading: Noisy air conditioner
Data.Observation: The office air conditioner made a loud, disturbing noise. It does not indicate a breakage, but it is a nuisance.

Data.Heading: Crack in the floor tile
Data.Observation: There was a crack in the concrete floor of the warehouse aisle, which, however, did not pose a tripping hazard.

Data.Heading: The smoke alarm flashes red
Data.Observation: A smoke alarm on the ceiling of the hallway flashed a red light, indicating a low battery or malfunction.

Data.Heading: Computer screen too low
Data.Observation: At the workstation, the employee's screen was too low, which caused a poor ergonomic posture.

Data.Heading: The sewer of the water supply smells
Data.Observation: The drain in the break room smelled bad. Most likely, it only requires cleaning.

Data.Heading: Crane inspection late
Data.Observation: The statutory periodic inspection of the production overhead crane was two weeks late.

Data.Heading: Frozen emergency exit
Data.Observation: In the winter, one of the emergency exits on the yard side had frozen shut and would not open.

Data.Heading: Dusty ventilation valve
Data.Observation: The ventilation valve in the office was very dusty. Affects air quality, but is not an immediate danger.

Data.Heading: Damaged fire extinguisher
Data.Observation: The pressure gauge of the powder extinguisher was red and the hose was broken.

Data.Heading: Tool dropped on the floor
Data.Observation: The maintenance man had dropped the hammer on a high service platform, from where it could have fallen down.

Data.Heading: There is no guide sign
Data.Observation: The route of the new premises had not yet been signposted, causing people to get lost.

Data.Heading: Automatic door closes too quickly
Data.Observation: The automatic door in the entrance hall closed so quickly that it caused a risk of crushing.

Data.Heading: Hand sanitizer at the end
Data.Observation: The hand sanitizer dispenser at the entrance to the cleanrooms was empty.

Data.Heading: Broken pallet trolley
Data.Observation: The pump mechanism of one of the pallet trucks did not work properly, which made lifting the load difficult and unstable.

Data.Heading: Wall clock stopped
Data.Observation: The wall clock in the break room had stopped. Only a nuisance, not a danger.

Data.Heading: Icicle at risk of falling
Data.Observation: A large icicle hung above the main door, threatening to fall into the passage.

Data.Heading: Faulty Production Machine Sensor
Data.Observation: The machine's safety sensor constantly gave error alarms, which led to it being overtaken by workers.

Data.Heading: Leaking compressed air hose
Data.Observation: The compressed air hose leaked from its connector, causing hissing and energy loss. No immediate danger.

Data.Heading: Dim lighting between shelves
Data.Observation: It was so dim in one of the shelves in the warehouse that it was difficult to read the product labels.

Data.Heading: Clogged floor drain
Data.Observation: The floor drain in the cleaning area was clogged, which caused water to accumulate on the floor and a risk of slipping.

Data.Heading: Door pump broken
Data.Observation: The heavy fire door was slammed shut with force because the door retarder was broken. Risk of crushing.

Data.Heading: Expired batteries in the device
Data.Observation: The rarely used measuring device had expired batteries. No danger, but prevents the use of the device.

Data.Heading: Unclear markings on the chemical bottle
Data.Observation: The label on the laboratory reagent bottle was so worn that the contents could not be ascertained.

Data.Heading: Parking space too narrow
Data.Observation: One of the parking spaces was painted too narrow, which made it difficult to get out of the car.

Data.Heading: Broken keyboard
Data.Observation: The shared office keyboard did not register all keystrokes. Ergonomic disadvantage and retardation.

Data.Heading: Emergency shower testing neglected
Data.Observation: The weekly emergency shower testing had not been carried out as scheduled.

Kiire.prompt: View the safety observations for March. How many of the observations were caused by haste and what was the most typical safety-related risk?
Kiire.translation:
Analysis of safety observations due to urgency (March 2024)
Based on this more extensive simulated material, a total of 20 safety observations were made in March, the root cause of which can be identified as being in a hurry.
The observations were identified either by direct mention ("in a hurry", "hastily", "quickly") or by actions that strongly indicate hurry and ignoring safety instructions (taking a shortcut, running, bypassing safety devices).
The most typical safety risk caused by rushing
When examining these 20 observations, the most typical risk related to rushing was preventing or endangering the use of routes and safety equipment.
This general risk is clearly distinguishable from the data and manifests itself in the following ways:
Obstruction of safety devices and areas (5 observations): This was the most common single manifestation. In a hurry, items such as trolleys and trolleys were left in places where they blocked access to the emergency stop button, emergency shower or blocked the fire corridor.
Examples: "Emergency stop button covered", "Fire corridor partially blocked", "Stuff left in front of the emergency shower".
Endangering access routes (4 observations): This category includes causing a tripping and collision hazard on access routes. This was done by leaving things on the stairs, running in the corridors or taking shortcuts outside the marked routes.
Examples: "Goods left on the stairs", "Employee ran in the corridor", "Adjustment in the production room".
Although the rush also caused other serious risks, such as exposure to chemicals (e.g. "Inadequate use of protective equipment", "Sample container left open") and process safety risks (e.g. "Documentation inadequate", "Machine cleaning skipped") was clearly the most common consequence of rushing in this material.

Data.Heading: Heavy lifting without aids
Data.Observation: A warehouse worker lifted a 25 kg sack from the floor alone without a lifting aid, a clear ergonomic risk.

Data.Heading: Emergency stop button covered
Data.Observation: In a hurry, the worker moved the wagon in front of the production line's emergency stop button, preventing it from being used.

Data.Heading: Scratch on the wall
Data.Observation: The forklift has hit the wall and caused a deep scratch on the wall surface of the corridor. Only cosmetic damage.

Data.Heading: Smoke alarm battery out
Data.Observation: The smoke alarm in the break room beeped sparsely, indicating that the battery was running out.

Data.Heading: Chemical splash on the floor
Data.Observation: In the laboratory, a small amount of solvent had been spilled on the floor in a hurry, which had not been cleaned or marked.

Data.Heading: Fire corridor partially blocked
Data.Observation: The pallet truck had been left in a hurry in a narrow fire corridor, which made it difficult to move around and prevented a quick exit.

Data.Heading: Leaking compressed air hose
Data.Observation: The compressed air hose leaked from its connector, causing hissing and energy loss. No immediate danger.

Data.Heading: Open switchboard
Data.Observation: The door of the electrical center in the service room had been left open, leaving the live parts touchable.

Data.Heading: Inadequate use of protective equipment
Data.Observation: The employee went 'just quickly' to get a sample from the powder handling room without the required respirator.

Data.Heading: The locker door does not lock
Data.Observation: The door of one of the wardrobes in the dressing room does not lock properly. Does not pose a safety risk.

Data.Heading: Tools left on top of the machine
Data.Observation: At the end of a busy working day, the caretaker had left a wrench on the mixer unit, from where it could have fallen off when the machine started.

Data.Heading: Inadequate lighting on the stairs
Data.Observation: The lighting in the stairwell leading to the basement was inadequate, one lamp was burnt out.

Data.Heading: Adjustment in production mode
Data.Observation: The employee took a shortcut across the forklift route from outside the marked routes to save time.

Data.Heading: An employee ran in the corridor
Data.Observation: An employee ran in the production corridor to get to the next work phase, which caused a collision hazard.

Data.Heading: Sharp edge at the workstation
Data.Observation: The metal worktop of the packaging line had a sharp edge that you could hurt yourself on.

Data.Heading: Incomplete documentation
Data.Observation: The batch's manufacturing documentation was hastily filled out and lacked critical signatures and values.

Data.Heading: Trash bin full
Data.Observation: The paper collection container in the break room is full. It does not cause danger, but it is untidy.

Data.Heading: Gas cylinders without support
Data.Observation: The gas cylinders in the laboratory stood freely against the wall without a chain or rack.

Data.Heading: Sample container left open
Data.Observation: In a hurry, the employee left a sample container containing the active substance open on the table, causing a risk of exposure and contamination.

Data.Heading: Faulty pallet trolley
Data.Observation: The pump mechanism of one of the pallet trucks did not work properly, which made it difficult to lift the load.

Data.Heading: Stuff left in front of the emergency shower
Data.Observation: The employee had momentarily left a trolley full of stuff directly in front of the emergency shower.

Data.Heading: Worn floor covering
Data.Observation: The floor covering in the cleanroom was worn out, making cleaning difficult and causing a tripping hazard.

Data.Heading: Cleaning neglected in a hurry
Data.Observation: The cleaning of the weighing room had been done hastily at the end of the shift, and there were clearly powder residues on the surfaces.

Data.Heading: Damaged extension cord
Data.Observation: The insulation of the office extension cord had cracked, exposing internal wires.

Data.Heading: The liquid in the eyewash bottle has expired
Data.Observation: The eyewash bottle at the emergency shower station had expired.

Data.Heading: A forklift was speeding
Data.Observation: In the warehouse area, the forklift driver drove clearly over the permitted speed limit in order to catch up on schedule.

Data.Heading: Hand washing station soap out of stock
Data.Observation: When entering the cleanroom, the soap dispenser at the hand washing station was empty.

Data.Heading: False alarm acknowledged
Data.Observation: The reactor pressure alarm was dismissed without checking the reason because 'it always does it'. Hurry to continue the process.

Data.Heading: Broken glass on the floor
Data.Observation: In the laboratory, a beaker glass had fallen and shards had spread over a wide area.

Data.Heading: Working without gloves
Data.Observation: The employee handled 'only one' sample without protective gloves because she was in a hurry.

Data.Heading: Swinging railing on the stairs
Data.Observation: On the metal stairs between the production facilities, the railing swayed dangerously.

Data.Heading: Stuff left on the stairs
Data.Observation: Empty boxes had been left on the upper level of the stairs leading to the warehouse in a hurry.

Data.Heading: Noisy device
Data.Observation: One of the machines on the production line made an exceptionally loud, hissing noise.

Data.Heading: Crane safety limit passed
Data.Observation: The worker passed the crane's safety limit to get the load into place faster.

Data.Heading: The door slams shut
Data.Observation: The door of the production facility slammed slammed shut, risk of crushing.

Data.Heading: Floor hatch poorly marked
Data.Observation: The floor hatch was open due to maintenance work, but there were no proper warning markings around it.

Data.Heading: Cable in the walkway
Data.Observation: A charging cable had been pulled across the office corridor, a tripping hazard.

Data.Heading: Safety glasses fogged up
Data.Observation: The employee had put the fogged goggles on his forehead in the middle of the work because he could not see properly and was in a hurry to finish the work.

Data.Heading: Shelf overloaded
Data.Observation: The storage shelf had more stuff stacked than its weight limit allowed.

Data.Heading: Emergency exit locked
Data.Observation: One of the emergency exits was locked with a key from the inside.

Data.Heading: Falling objects from the shelf
Data.Observation: The vibration caused small items to fall off the shelf near the production line.

Data.Heading: Incorrect batch number posted
Data.Observation: In a hurry, the employee had entered the batch number of the wrong starting material in the production documentation.

Data.Heading: Inadequate ergonomics in the packing room
Data.Observation: The work surface on the packaging line was too low, causing the workers to stooped over their working position.

Data.Heading: Missing warning sign
Data.Observation: There was no sign warning about the wet floor after cleaning.

Data.Heading: Staircase step broken
Data.Observation: One of the steps on the concrete stairs was chipped, with a sharp edge and a pit.

Data.Heading: Machine cleaning skipped
Data.Observation: During the shift change, the intermediate cleaning of the machine was not done due to haste, causing a risk of cross-contamination.

Data.Heading: Icicles on the edge of the roof
Data.Observation: Large icicles hung above the main entrance, danger of falling.

Data.Heading: An employee was talking on a mobile phone on the stairs
Data.Observation: The employee walked down the stairs while looking at the phone screen, distracted.

Data.Heading: Slippery outdoor staircase in the rain
Data.Observation: The factory's exterior stairs were very slippery in the rain, no roughening.

Data.Heading: Security fence door left open
Data.Observation: The door of the security fence leading to the robot cell had been left open because 'you just had to go there quickly'.

Data.Heading: A heavy object on the edge of the shelf
Data.Observation: On a high storage shelf, there was a heavy box dangerously close to the edge.

Data.Heading: Faulty fire extinguisher
Data.Observation: The pressure gauge of the powder extinguisher was red.

Data.Heading: Chemical container without label
Data.Observation: The chemical container brought in for weighing was without the appropriate label.

Data.Heading: Connection made in a hurry
Data.Observation: The electrician made the temporary connection in a hurry and left it undocumented and unmarked.

Käsittelyaika.prompt: Analyze all safety findings for 2024. What was the average processing time in the observations? Are there any trends, what kind of observations have a longer processing time than normal?
Käsittelyaika.translation:
Analysis of the processing times of safety observations (2024)
Average Processing Time
Based on this simulated data, the average processing time for safety observations in 2024 is approximately 5 days.
The processing time is calculated as the difference in days between the date of the observation (havainto_pvm) and the processing date (havainto_käsitelty_pvm).
Trends in longer processing times
By analysing observations with longer-than-average processing times, clear trends can be identified. A longer processing time is typically associated with observations that are not a simple and immediate measure to correct.
The most common reasons for longer processing times are:
1. Structural repairs and more extensive installation work (Processing time typically 1-3 weeks) These often require an external contractor, special materials or design and cannot be implemented immediately.
Example: "Stair step broken" (12 days) – Repairing concrete requires preparation, drying time and possibly special expertise.
Example: "Worn floor covering" (21 days) – Renewing a cleanroom floor covering is an extensive job that requires a production break and a special contractor.
2. Complex technical faults and investigations (Processing time typically 1-4 weeks) Observations related to the modification of machinery, equipment or systems (e.g. HVAC) for defects whose root cause requires expertise, ordering spare parts or stopping production.
Example: "Crane safety limit does not work" (10 days) – It takes time to troubleshoot and order and install any sensor or part.
Example: "Noisy device" (12 days) – Requires a service examination, noise measurements, and possibly a spare parts order.
Example: "Faulty ventilation in a cleanroom" (24 days) – Requires the presence of an HVAC expert, an examination of the system, and possibly a more extensive repair project.
3. Improvements that require more extensive planning (Processing time typically > 3 weeks) These findings are not immediate defects, but shortcomings that require planning, budgeting, and a project-based approach to fix. Observations related to ergonomics are a typical example.
Example: "Inadequate ergonomics in the packing room" (31 days) – Improving the ergonomics of a workstation often requires analyzing the work, interviewing several employees, and possibly designing and purchasing a completely new workstation solution.
Summary: The shortest processing times (1–3 days) are typically for observations that can be corrected immediately by cleaning, organizing, or providing feedback (e.g., Cleanup). "A puddle of water in the hallway", "Stuff left on the stairs"). Processing times are significantly extended when correcting the observation requires special expertise, spare parts, external contractors or more extensive planning and project work.

Data.Heading: Water pond in the hallway
Data.Observation: There was a small puddle of water on the floor of the packaging department, which posed a risk of slipping.

Data.Heading: Swinging railing on the stairs
Data.Observation: On the metal stairs between the production facilities, the railing swayed dangerously. The fastening failed.

Data.Heading: Inadequate protective clothing
Data.Observation: The employee handled the powdered substance without a respirator in a clean room.

Data.Heading: Stuff left on the stairs
Data.Observation: Empty boxes had been left on the upper level of the stairs leading to the warehouse, there was a risk of tripping.

Data.Heading: Chemical splash on the floor
Data.Observation: In the laboratory, there was a small amount of unknown chemicals on the floor without a warning label.

Data.Heading: Emergency stop button covered
Data.Observation: In front of the emergency stop button on the mixer unit, there was a movable trolley that prevented quick operation.

Data.Heading: Slippery step
Data.Observation: One of the steps leading to the service platform was dangerously slippery.

Data.Heading: Heavy lifting without aids
Data.Observation: The warehouse worker lifted the heavy bag of raw materials alone without a lifting aid.

Data.Heading: Fire corridor blocked
Data.Observation: In front of the emergency exit, there was a pallet full of cardboard waste, which narrowed the passageway.

Data.Heading: Broken socket
Data.Observation: The casing of the socket in the dressing room was cracked, risk of electric shock.

Data.Heading: Inadequate lighting on the stairs
Data.Observation: The lighting in the stairwell leading to the basement was inadequate, one lamp was burnt out.

Data.Heading: Sharp edge at the workstation
Data.Observation: The metal worktop of the packaging line had a sharp edge that you could hurt yourself on.

Data.Heading: Tools on the floor
Data.Observation: After the maintenance work, a wrench and screwdrivers had been left on the floor.

Data.Heading: Liquid splash on the stairs
Data.Observation: Coffee had spilled on the stairs leading to the break room, causing a slipping hazard.

Data.Heading: Dust accumulated in the electrical cabinet
Data.Observation: A lot of dust had accumulated inside the old electrical cabinet of the production facility, a risk of fire.

Data.Heading: Incorrect waste sorting
Data.Observation: Reactive chemical waste had been placed in a normal laboratory waste container.

Data.Heading: An employee ran up the stairs
Data.Observation: The employee was observed running down the stairs on the office floor.

Data.Heading: Gas cylinders without support
Data.Observation: The gas cylinders in the laboratory stood freely against the wall without a chain or rack.

Data.Heading: Shelf overloaded
Data.Observation: The storage shelf had more stuff stacked than its weight limit allowed.

Data.Heading: Worn floor covering
Data.Observation: The floor covering in the cleanroom was worn out, making cleaning difficult and causing a tripping hazard.

Data.Heading: The anti-slip stair has come loose
Data.Observation: The anti-slip tape had come off the edge of the staircase leading to the front door and was torn.

Data.Heading: Damaged extension cord
Data.Observation: The insulation of the office extension cord had cracked, exposing internal wires.

Data.Heading: The liquid in the eyewash bottle has expired
Data.Observation: The eyewash bottle at the emergency shower station had expired.

Data.Heading: A forklift was speeding
Data.Observation: In the warehouse area, the forklift driver drove clearly over the permitted speed limit.

Data.Heading: Carrying a big box up the stairs
Data.Observation: The employee was carrying a large box that completely blocked the view when going up the stairs.

Data.Heading: Incomplete safety data sheets
Data.Observation: The safety data sheet for the new chemical could not be found at the workstation.

Data.Heading: Air conditioning duct leaks condensate
Data.Observation: An air conditioning duct in the ceiling of the corridor dripped condensate onto the floor.

Data.Heading: Muffler disconnected from the machine
Data.Observation: The muffler had come loose from the compressed air device, causing a lot of noise.

Data.Heading: Pharmaceutical dust on surfaces
Data.Observation: Pharmaceutical dust had remained on the surfaces of the weighing room after cleaning.

Data.Heading: Dim lighting in the warehouse
Data.Observation: At the back of the warehouse, the lighting was so dim that it was difficult to read the labels of the products.

Data.Heading: Garbage left on the stairs
Data.Observation: There was rubbish and empty coffee cups on the stairs of the break room.

Data.Heading: A heavy object on the edge of the shelf
Data.Observation: On a high storage shelf, there was a heavy box dangerously close to the edge.

Data.Heading: The door slams shut
Data.Observation: The door of the production facility slammed slammed shut, risk of crushing.

Data.Heading: Floor hatch poorly marked
Data.Observation: The floor hatch was open due to maintenance work, but there were no proper warning markings around it.

Data.Heading: Cable in the walkway
Data.Observation: A charging cable had been pulled across the office corridor, a tripping hazard.

Data.Heading: Protective gloves broken
Data.Observation: The employee wore broken protective gloves when handling the corrosive substance.

Data.Heading: Swinging stair railing
Data.Observation: The railing of the stairs at the main entrance swayed and gave way when leaning.

Data.Heading: The crane safety limit does not work
Data.Observation: The upper limit sensor of the production overhead crane did not work, causing a collision hazard.

Data.Heading: Broken glass on the floor
Data.Observation: In the laboratory, a beaker glass had fallen and shards had spread over a wide area.

Data.Heading: Hand washing station soap out of stock
Data.Observation: When entering the cleanroom, the soap dispenser at the hand washing station was empty.

Data.Heading: Slippery outdoor staircase in the rain
Data.Observation: The factory's exterior stairs were very slippery in the rain, no roughening.

Data.Heading: Emergency exit locked
Data.Observation: One of the emergency exits was locked with a key from the inside.

Data.Heading: Falling objects from the shelf
Data.Observation: The vibration caused small items to fall off the shelf near the production line.

Data.Heading: Wet rag on the stairs
Data.Observation: The cleaner had left a wet rag to dry on top of the stair railing, from where it had fallen onto the step.

Data.Heading: Inadequate ergonomics in the packing room
Data.Observation: The work surface on the packaging line was too low, causing the workers to stooped over their working position. Requires a more extensive investigation and possibly redesign of the workstation.

Data.Heading: Missing warning sign
Data.Observation: There was no sign warning about the wet floor after cleaning.

Data.Heading: Staircase step broken
Data.Observation: One of the steps on the concrete stairs was chipped, with a sharp edge and a pit. Requires concrete repair.

Data.Heading: Noisy device
Data.Observation: One of the machines on the production line made an exceptionally loud, hissing noise. Requires maintenance, examination and possibly a spare parts order.

Data.Heading: Icicles on the edge of the roof
Data.Observation: Large icicles hung above the main entrance, danger of falling.

Data.Heading: An employee was talking on a mobile phone on the stairs
Data.Observation: The employee walked down the stairs while looking at the phone screen, distracted.

Data.Heading: Faulty ventilation in the cleanroom
Data.Observation: The ventilation in the cleanroom did not work properly, which compromises the quality of the product and the safety of the personnel. Requires an examination by an HVAC expert.

Sähköturvallisuus.prompt: Analyse the observations related to electrical safety from 2024 to 2025. Is there an up/down trend over time?

Data.Heading: The warning sign is missing from the electrical cabinet
Data.Observation: The door of the electrical cabinet is completely missing a warning marking. The locker is located in a public passage area.

Data.Heading: Water leaked from the coffee machine
Data.Observation: Water had leaked directly onto the floor on the lower level of the coffee machine in the office space. I also noticed that liquid had been splashed near the electrical outlet, which posed a potential safety risk.

Data.Heading: Socket at the front door in a dangerous space
Data.Observation: The socket at the front door was hanging right on the floor and was partially broken. Potential risk of electric shock, especially during rain.

Data.Heading: An extension cord runs across the hallway
Data.Observation: In the office corridor, an extension cord had been pulled across the floor between two workstations. Tripping hazard and risk of damage to the cord.

Data.Heading: Electrical cabinet open in the production area
Data.Observation: The electrical distribution cabinet in the production facility had been left open unattended. There were no warning labels or protection in the cabinet.

Data.Heading: Damaged electrical cord
Data.Observation: A damaged electrical cable was found in the warehouse, the insulation of which had worn out in several places, with the exposed wires visible.

Data.Heading: Overloading the socket
Data.Observation: One socket had six devices connected through a branch plug. Overload risk and fire hazard.

Data.Heading: Wet floor near electrical appliances
Data.Observation: After the cleaning work, the floor was wet in the immediate vicinity of electrical outlets and appliances.

Data.Heading: Broken light switch
Data.Observation: The light switch hung off the wall and the insides were visible. Risk of electric shock.

Data.Heading: Damaged power cord
Data.Observation: The insulation of the power cable of the production equipment had cracked in several places, exposing the metal conductor.

Data.Heading: Power tools on wet floors
Data.Observation: Battery-powered power tools had been left on the floor next to a wet area at the loading dock door.

Data.Heading: Residual current device is missing
Data.Observation: The socket for outdoor use lacked a residual current device, even though it is mandatory for outdoor use.

Data.Heading: Inadequate fastening of the electrical cable
Data.Observation: The electric cable hanging from the ceiling was attached at only one point and swayed dangerously.

Data.Heading: Unattended charging area
Data.Observation: There were several devices in the battery charging area charging overnight without supervision or fire safety equipment.

Data.Heading: Goods in front of the main switchboard
Data.Observation: Goods had been stored in front of the main switchboard, which prevented access in an emergency.

Data.Heading: Damaged extension cord in use
Data.Observation: An extension cord was used, the insulation of which was clearly damaged and the cord had been repaired with tape.

Data.Heading: Humidity in the electrical cabinet
Data.Observation: Moisture and rust marks were detected in the electrical cabinet in the basement.

Data.Heading: Using electrical appliances outdoors in the rain
Data.Observation: A person operated a power tool outdoors in heavy rain without proper protection.

Data.Heading: Socket cover broken
Data.Observation: The protective cover of the workstation socket was cracked and the internal parts were partially visible.

Data.Heading: UPS Device Warns of Fault
Data.Observation: The UPS device in the server room gave a continuous warning sound, but the device had not been serviced.

Data.Heading: Electrical cabinet unlocked
Data.Observation: The electrical distribution cabinet in the production facility was unlocked, even though it should be locked to prevent unauthorized access.

Data.Heading: Wrong plug in use
Data.Observation: The appliance had the wrong type of plug that did not fit properly into the socket.

Data.Heading: Electrical work without a permit
Data.Observation: It was noticed that the person was doing electrical installation work without the appropriate permit or qualifications.

Data.Heading: Indoor generator
Data.Observation: The backup power generator was placed indoors without adequate ventilation.

Data.Heading: Electrical equipment cord pinched
Data.Observation: Under the heavy shelf, the power cord of electrical appliances was pinched.

Data.Heading: Removing the lamp cover
Data.Observation: The protective cover of the ceiling lamp was detached and hanging from wires.

Data.Heading: Engine overheated
Data.Observation: The electric motor of the production unit was overheated and smelled of burnt smell.

Data.Heading: Electrical panel markings are missing
Data.Observation: The electrical panel lacked all markings, so it was impossible to identify the fuses and switches.

Data.Heading: Plug contact surfaces visible
Data.Observation: The plastic casing of the plug was cracked and the metal contact surfaces were partially visible.

Data.Heading: Temporary electrical installation remains permanent
Data.Observation: The electrical installation, which was intended to be temporary, had been in use for more than a year without an official inspection.

Data.Heading: Electrical appliances in dusty environments
Data.Observation: The electrical equipment was in a very dusty environment without proper protection.

Data.Heading: Unplug the ground wire
Data.Observation: The ground wire of the device was disconnected from the connection point.

Data.Heading: Electrical cabinet rusted
Data.Observation: The outdoor electrical distribution cabinet was badly rusted and its seals were broken.

Data.Heading: Lamps flicker
Data.Observation: The lights in the office space are constantly flickering, which indicates an electrical problem.

Data.Heading: Charging batteries in an unsafe space
Data.Observation: Lithium batteries were charged in a storage facility without fire safety equipment or supervision.

Data.Heading: Neglected maintenance of electrical equipment
Data.Observation: The scheduled maintenance of the production equipment was delayed by three months.

Data.Heading: Insufficient number of sockets
Data.Observation: There were too few sockets at the workstation, which led to the chaining of the splitters.

Data.Heading: The route of the electric cable is dangerous
Data.Observation: The electric cable ran across the forklift aisle without protection.

Data.Heading: Water dripping from the lamp
Data.Observation: Water was dripping from the ceiling lamp, which indicates a water leak and an electrical safety risk.

Data.Heading: Emergency stop button covered
Data.Observation: The plane's emergency stop button was partially covered with items.

Data.Heading: The electric motor makes abnormal noises
Data.Observation: The electric motor of the production unit made an abnormal noise, which may indicate a fault.

Data.Heading: Socket installation incorrect
Data.Observation: The new socket had been installed incorrectly and it was loose in the wall.

Data.Heading: Electrical appliances too close to a water source
Data.Observation: The electrical appliances had been placed too close to the water point without observing safety distances.

Data.Heading: Cable channel full
Data.Observation: The cable duct was full of wires, which could cause overheating.

Data.Heading: Using a power tool without training
Data.Observation: The person used a power tool for which he was not trained.

Data.Heading: Lamp attachment is weak
Data.Observation: The attachment of the work lamp was weak and the lamp wobbled dangerously.

Data.Heading: Instructions for using electrical appliances are missing
Data.Observation: The new electrical appliances lacked instructions for use and safety markings in Finnish.

Data.Heading: The residual current device trips repeatedly
Data.Observation: The residual current device in a certain area trips repeatedly, indicating a problem with the power grid.

Data.Heading: Electrical panel ventilation blocked
Data.Observation: The ventilation holes of the electrical panel were blocked with dust and dirt.

Data.Heading: Portable charger cord damaged
Data.Observation: The laptop charger cord was badly damaged and the internal wires were visible.

Lokaatio.prompt: In relative terms, what proportion of all events in December 2024 took place in offices, production facilities and outdoor spaces?

Data.Heading: Damaged electrical cord
Data.Observation: A damaged electrical cable was found in the warehouse, the insulation of which had worn out in several places, with the exposed wires visible.

Data.Heading: Unattended charging area
Data.Observation: There were several devices in the battery charging area charging overnight without supervision or fire safety equipment.

Data.Heading: UPS Device Warns of Fault
Data.Observation: The UPS device in the server room gave a continuous warning sound, but the device had not been serviced.

Data.Heading: Electrical panel markings are missing
Data.Observation: The electrical panel lacked all markings, so it was impossible to identify the fuses and switches.

Data.Heading: Charging batteries in an unsafe space
Data.Observation: Lithium batteries were charged in a storage facility without fire safety equipment or supervision.

Data.Heading: The electric motor makes abnormal noises
Data.Observation: The electric motor of the production unit made an abnormal noise, which may indicate a fault.

Data.Heading: Instructions for using electrical appliances are missing
Data.Observation: The new electrical appliances lacked instructions for use and safety markings in Finnish.

Data.Heading: Stair railing wobbles
Data.Observation: The stair railing has detached from its fastener and wobbles when used.

Data.Heading: Wet floor in the hallway
Data.Observation: A large and slippery puddle of water was noticed on the floor of the corridor. It is likely that water has leaked from the outdoor shoes.

Data.Heading: Trash bin full
Data.Observation: The trash can in the hallway was so full that the trash spilled over the edges.

Data.Heading: Untidy workstation on the production line
Data.Observation: Extra items, tools and materials had accumulated at the workstation. The passage had narrowed and the risk of tripping had increased.

Data.Heading: Cold chain broken
Data.Observation: The material delivered to the refrigerator had been left in the warm space of the arrival pier for an unknown period of time before being stored.

Data.Heading: Freezer door ajar
Data.Observation: The freezer door had been left ajar, which caused energy loss and possible temperature fluctuations.

Data.Heading: Hand towel on the floor
Data.Observation: There was a hand towel on the floor of the hand washing station that had fallen off the hook.

Data.Heading: First aid cabinet incomplete
Data.Observation: I checked the contents of the first aid cabinet and noticed that it was missing several basic supplies, such as a wound dressing and tape rolls.

Data.Heading: Slippery in the parking lot
Data.Observation: The asphalt of the parking lot was frozen in the morning and several people almost slipped.

Data.Heading: A pile of snow blocks visibility
Data.Observation: The plough truck had left a large pile of snow at the intersection, which blocks the visibility to traffic.

Data.Heading: Ice on the stairs
Data.Observation: There was ice on the outer stairs that had not been sanded.

Data.Heading: Outdoor lighting in the dark
Data.Observation: The outdoor lighting in the parking area did not work, which made the area dark and dangerous.

Data.Heading: Out of sanding sand
Data.Observation: The area near the front doors had run out of sanding sand, even though the weather was slippery.

Data.Heading: Forklift warning lights broken
Data.Observation: The forklift's hazard lights did not work, which makes it difficult to notice others.

Data.Heading: Emergency exit light in the dark
Data.Observation: The emergency exit signal light had gone out and the route could not be seen in the dark.

Data.Heading: Floor drain clogged
Data.Observation: The floor drain in the production facility was clogged and water was collecting on the floor.

Data.Heading: The smoke alarm beeps
Data.Observation: The smoke alarm in the office kept beeping, which interfered with work.

Data.Heading: Pallet at an angle
Data.Observation: On the storage shelf, the pallet was crooked and threatened to tip over.

Data.Heading: Forklift aisle markings worn out
Data.Observation: The markings on the floor of the forklift aisle had worn almost invisible.

Data.Heading: Ventilation does not work
Data.Observation: The ventilation in the meeting room did not work and the air was stuffy.

Data.Heading: Door pump broken
Data.Observation: The door pump of the front door was broken and the door slammed slammed shut.

Data.Heading: Office chair broken
Data.Observation: The back of the office chair was broken and the chair tilted dangerously.

Data.Heading: Elevator stuck
Data.Observation: The freight elevator got stuck between two floors.

Data.Heading: Poor lighting in the storage area
Data.Observation: The lighting in the storage area was insufficient for safe work.

Data.Heading: Unevenness of the floor
Data.Observation: There was an uneven spot on the floor of the production facility that was easy to trip over.

Data.Heading: Protective equipment is missing
Data.Observation: The work site lacked mandatory protective equipment.

Data.Heading: Chemical container leaks
Data.Observation: The lid of the chemical container was loose and the contents had spilled onto the floor.

Data.Heading: The crane does not work
Data.Observation: The warehouse crane did not respond to use and got stuck.

Data.Heading: Slip marks visible
Data.Observation: There was a slip mark on the floor, where the person had clearly slipped.

Data.Heading: Toolbox open on the floor
Data.Observation: The toolbox had been left open in the middle of the corridor.

Data.Heading: Dust has accumulated in the engine room
Data.Observation: A lot of dust had accumulated in the engine room, which is a fire safety risk.

Data.Heading: Access card left in the reader
Data.Observation: The key card had been left in the reader and the door was open.

Data.Heading: Fire blanket missing
Data.Observation: The kitchen lacked a fire blanket, even though it is a must-have.

Data.Heading: Warning plate knocked over
Data.Observation: The warning sign for the wet floor had fallen on the floor.

Data.Heading: A person was running up the stairs
Data.Observation: The person ran down the stairs, carrying the items in both hands.

Data.Heading: Protective gloves broken
Data.Observation: The protective gloves used in the work were broken in several places.

Data.Heading: The production line stopped abruptly
Data.Observation: The production line stopped abruptly without warning.

Data.Heading: Alarm button untested
Data.Observation: The emergency alarm button had not been tested in connection with scheduled maintenance.

Data.Heading: Gas cylinder without attachment
Data.Observation: The gas cylinder stood freely without attachment to the wall.

Data.Heading: Leak in the compressed air hose
Data.Observation: There was a leak in the compressed air hose that caused a strong jet.

Data.Heading: Floor painting worn out
Data.Observation: The safety painting on the floor of the production facility had worn off.

Data.Heading: The door does not have a window
Data.Observation: The door to the production facility does not have a window, which creates a risk of collision.

Kesto.prompt: How long has the average processing time been for the observations of Assembly Department B, broken down by month in 2024?

Data.Heading: The robotic arm moved unexpectedly
Data.Observation: The robotic arm of the assembly department B was activated in the middle of maintenance work without warning. Fortunately, the maintenance man had just left the safety zone.

Data.Heading: Strong smell of hydraulic oil
Data.Observation: There was a strong smell of oil near the hydraulic unit of assembly B. A small leak in the system is suspected.

Data.Heading: Compressed air condensate on the floor
Data.Observation: Condensate had leaked from the discharge valve of the compressed air line in assembly department B onto the floor, creating a slipping hazard.

Data.Heading: Pallets stacked dangerously high
Data.Observation: In the intermediate warehouse of Ward B, the pallets were stacked to a height of more than three metres without a support structure.

Data.Heading: The temperature sensor displays incorrectly
Data.Observation: The temperature sensor in configuration B showed -5°C, even though the room was clearly at normal room temperature.

Data.Heading: Reduced airflow in the fume cupboard
Data.Observation: The airflow in the fume cupboard of compartment B had deteriorated significantly. The smoke test showed insufficient suction power.

Data.Heading: The roller track gets stuck randomly
Data.Observation: The conveyor roller conveyor of assembly B stops randomly for no apparent reason, causing production interruptions.

Data.Heading: Refrigeration unit door frozen shut
Data.Observation: The door of the refrigeration unit of ward B had frozen shut and required a violent opening.

Data.Heading: Pressure Relief Valve Leak
Data.Observation: The pressure relief valve in Assembly Compartment B is leaking and making a hissing noise.

Data.Heading: Laser cutter safety glasses lost
Data.Observation: The safety glasses of the laser workstation in ward B had disappeared and spare glasses were not available.

Data.Heading: Cart's wheel stuck
Data.Observation: One wheel of the transport trolley used in configuration B is jammed and the trolley is running at an angle.

Data.Heading: Vacuum cleaner overheated
Data.Observation: The industrial vacuum cleaner in Ward B shut down due to overheating in the middle of use.

Data.Heading: Sensor system gives false alarms
Data.Observation: The safety sensor system in Configuration B gives repeated false alarms, stopping production.

Data.Heading: Chemical leakage from a small container
Data.Observation: In ward B, a small container of solvent had fallen over and the contents had spilled under the worktop.

Data.Heading: Lifting rope frayed
Data.Observation: The lifting rope of Assembly Detachment B was frayed in several places and required immediate replacement.

Data.Heading: Condensation dripping from the air conditioning duct
Data.Observation: Water drips directly from the ventilation duct of ward B to the workstation.

Data.Heading: Welding gas cylinder valve leaks
Data.Observation: At the welding point of assembly B, the valve of the gas cylinder is leaking noticeably.

Data.Heading: The roller conveyor causes vibrations
Data.Observation: The roller conveyor in ward B causes strong vibrations that can be felt throughout the hall.

Data.Heading: The warning light does not work
Data.Observation: The rotating warning light in Assembly Compartment B no longer works at all.

Data.Heading: The epoxy on the floor is peeling off
Data.Observation: The epoxy coating on the floor of ward B flakes off over large areas, exposing the concrete.

Data.Heading: Air Force Gun Trigger Stuck
Data.Observation: The trigger of the air blow gun used in Assembly B got stuck, causing a continuous jet of air.

Data.Heading: The electric motor smells like burnt smell
Data.Observation: The engine of the conveyor system in ward B smelled of burnt smell during operation.

Data.Heading: Workwear storage cabinet full
Data.Observation: The workwear storage cabinet in assembly department B is full and some of the clothes are on the floor.

Data.Heading: The water in the emergency shower does not flow
Data.Observation: During the testing of the emergency shower in ward B, it was found that the water does not flow at sufficient pressure.

Data.Heading: Robot cell does not recognize components
Data.Observation: The robot cell in configuration B does not recognize the components due to a malfunction in the vision system.

Data.Heading: Tear in the floor
Data.Observation: A tear of about 30 cm has formed in the floor of ward B, which can be tripped over.

Data.Heading: Leakage of the quick coupling of the compressed air hose
Data.Observation: The quick coupling of the compressed air hose in assembly department B is constantly leaking air.

Data.Heading: Conveyor belt slides
Data.Observation: The conveyor belt in compartment B slides over the rollers, causing uneven transport.

Data.Heading: The workstation lamp flickers
Data.Observation: The LED light at the workstation in Configuration B flickers disturbingly.

Data.Heading: The angle grinder vibrates strongly
Data.Observation: The angle grinder in Compartment B vibrates abnormally strongly in use.

Data.Heading: Air purifier filter clogged
Data.Observation: The air purifier filter in Assembly Compartment B is completely clogged with dust.

Data.Heading: Operating instructions for the lifting device have been lost
Data.Observation: The operating instructions for the lifting device of Ward B have disappeared, and it was not possible to familiarize the new person.

Data.Heading: Underfloor heating does not work
Data.Observation: The underfloor heating in Configuration B does not work and the floor is cold.

Data.Heading: Tool trolley overturned
Data.Observation: In ward B, a tool trolley fell over when it was moved on an uneven floor.

Data.Heading: The pressure gauge shows zero
Data.Observation: The pressure gauge on the hydraulic pump in assembly department B shows zero even though the system is running.

Data.Heading: Torn protective curtain
Data.Observation: The protective curtain of the welding point of ward B has torn in several places.

Data.Heading: Warning tape detached
Data.Observation: The warning tape for the hazardous area of Assembly B had come off the floor.

Data.Heading: Compressed air hose whips
Data.Observation: In ward B, the compressed air hose came loose and began to whip dangerously around.

Data.Heading: Hook safety lock broken
Data.Observation: The safety lock on the lifting hook in Assembly Section B no longer works.

Data.Heading: Workstation suction system blocked
Data.Observation: The suction system of the workstation in ward B is clogged and no longer suction at all.

Data.Heading: The floor drain smells
Data.Observation: An unpleasant smell comes from the floor drain in assembly B.

Data.Heading: The roller track goes too fast
Data.Observation: The speed of the roller conveyor in section B has increased and the components fall off easily.

Data.Heading: Emergency stop circuit does not work
Data.Observation: The emergency stop circuit of Assembly Detachment B did not stop the plane during the test.

Data.Heading: The desk at the workstation wobbles
Data.Observation: The desk at the workstation in Ward B wobbles dangerously and threatens to fall over.

Data.Heading: The compressed air dryer does not work
Data.Observation: Assembly B's compressed air dryer is out of order and there is moisture in the air.

Data.Heading: The conveyor scale shows the wrong
Data.Observation: The conveyor scale in section B constantly shows a weight that is 5 kg too light.
